extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup unsalted butter or olive oil

title: Baked Herb-parmesan Tilapia
summary: Baked Herb-parmesan Tilapia requires approximately 17 minutes from start to finish. For $7.86 per serving, you get a main course that serves 1. Watching your figure? This pescatarian recipe has 1010 calories, 79g of protein, and 66g of fat per serving. Head to the store and pick up salt & pepper, cayenne, seasoning, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. Overall, this recipe earns an amazing spoonacular score of 93%. Try Parmesan Herb Encrusted Tilapia, Baked Tilapia Parmesan, and Baked Parmesan Tilapia for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Tilapia. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 99 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris

instructions: Preheat oven to 400F.In shallow dish, melt butter *if using* or pour in olive oil. (Can use a mix of both, if preferred.)In another shallow dish, mix first 5 ingredients.Cover baking sheet with foil and spray lightly with cooking spray.Wash and dry fillets.Dip fillets in butter/oil to coat and dredge in herb-crumb mixture to completely cover.Let dry on wire rack for about 5 minutes to set coating.Place on foil-covered sheet and bake for about 10-12 minutes or until fish flakes easily.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400F.In shallow dish, melt butter *if using* or pour in olive oil. (Can use a mix of both, if preferred.)In another shallow dish, mix first 5 ingredients.Cover baking sheet with foil and spray lightly with cooking spray.Wash and dry fillets.Dip fillets in butter/oil to coat and dredge in herb-crumb mixture to completely cover.
Let dry on wire rack for about 5 minutes to set coating.
Place on foil-covered sheet and bake for about 10-12 minutes or until fish flakes easily.
